result.execSummary:
The defendant Omer T. Lundt IV was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Omer T. Lundt IV is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Omer T. Lundt IV was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Omer T. Lundt IV was found guilty of Possession of THC (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
12:09 p.m. Defendant Omer T. Lundt in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to amend Count 3 to ordinance violation posession of TCH and to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant pleads no contest.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Count 1
Jail - 15 days w/Huber for all purposes to commence on/before Friday November 13, 2015 at 4:00 p.m. 
Fine - $1379 (includes costs)
Driver's license revocation - 12 months
IID - 12 months
AODA Assessement
Driver's Safety Plan
Jail credit - 1 day

Count 3 
Fine - $589.00 (includes costs)

Court encourages defendant to apply with Clerk of Court for payment plan
Appeal rights given
Adj. 12:25 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:35 p.m. Defendant Omer T. Lundt in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states there has been a proposal from State - defendant needs to complete treatment and AODA asssessment - requests adjournment. State has no objection. Voorhees states willing to enter plea and proceed to later sentencing if Court wishes.  Bail continued. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:15 am. 2:37 pm.

2:31 p.m. Defendant Omer T. Lundt in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is not pursuing felony at this time. Court accepts motion to amend complaint striking Ct. 3 as felony - amended to simple possession of THC, misdemeanor.  Defendant pleads not guilty. Voorhees speaks to defendant's name correction- formal name should be Omer T. Lundt, IV; Court grants amendment to correct the name. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Omer T. Lundt in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:17
In receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

02:24 pm - Defendant Omer T. Lundt in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD, Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
